text.__SUMMARY__: Vipera berus sachalinensis (Sakhalin Island adder  a.k.a. Sakhalin adder) is a venomous viper subspecies endemic to Asia.
text.Geographic range: It is found in the Russian Far East (Amur), China (Jilin), North Korea, and on Sakhalin Island.According to Schwarz (1936), the type locality is "Sachalin" (= Sakhalin Island, Russia).
text.Taxonomy: McDiarmid et al. (1999) follow Golay et al. (1993) and recognize V. b. sachalinensis as a subspecies of V. berus. However, it has been considered a full species in recent literature.
